chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Nevoraski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:45 p.m. Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Timothy B Melms.  Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Melms/Nevoraski/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 20 days with Huber for all purposes concurrent to current sentence
WHS/POP 2 yrs - concurrent to current sentence 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Provide truthful testimony if subpoenaed
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 2:55 p.m.

10:03 a.m. Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy B Melms. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bond continued. Schiek states Information will remain same as single count on Complaint. Defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Contacted Attorney Melms office to inform of Preliminary Hearing date and to request a Notice of Retainer.  Spoke with Stacy.

03:19 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court,via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states attorney Timothy Melms unavailable to appear on today's date.  Defendant states Melms directed him to requests a preliminary hearing date.  Defendant waives prelim time limits.   Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Modifying Bond to allow incidental contact with co-defendant, Richard Nitschke, to allow defendant to work as a trustee in the Oneida County Jail.  There shall be no verbal interation or communication.  All of condition of bond previously set same remain - May not have contact with Andrea Healy

Modifying Bond to allow incidental contact with co-defendant, Richard Nitschke, to allow defendant to work as a trustee in the Oneida County Jail.  There shall be no verbal interation or communication.  All of condition of bond previously set same remain
May not have contact w/co-defendants, Andrea Healy and/or Richard Nitschke

11:17 am - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states has attorney, Timothy Melms,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
